name: El Careyes Beach Resort

reviews.title: Beautiful getaway
reviews.text: We stayed at El Careyes Beach Resort in mid-May and really enjoyed it. It was the perfect late spring getaway and after 4 days we felt pleasantly bored. The weather was in the 80's every day (just a bit humid) and the water was warm. It's a small but beautiful resort with less than 50 rooms and it never felt crowded. The pool is nice and there are tons of lounge chairs, however the actual beachfront is fairly short so while you can go in the water, it's not the place for long strolls down the beach (unless you want to go back and forth). The rooms are nice and spacious, however the bed was a bit on the firm side and the sheets were rough (or maybe I was sunburned!) for the type of place that seems like it should be obsessed with it's high thread-count. The staff is friendly and helpful. The mango daiquiries are fantastic! The restaurant is a bit over-priced and the menu never changes so plan to explore local places. You might check out a local seafood shack that we heard was good but never made it to, and ditto a nearby Italian restaurant. We did go to a great and really cheap restaurant nearby called La Loma that has terrific Mexican food and $1 beers (as opposed to $6 at the resort). A Brazilian steak place across the street from La Loma is supposed to be good and cheap as well. You'll need a car to get to these last 2 restaurants as they are about 15 min away by car. If possible, try to fly into Manzanillo airport and rent a car there. It's an easy 1 hr. drive -- as opposed to the 3 hr. ride from PV -- and then you don't have to pay for taxis etc. if you want to eat elsewhere.

My boyfriend and I stayed at El Careyes for a much needed vacation during the second week of March. We really enjoyed our stay. I pretty much agree with the other positive posts. We are in our late twenties and in general, the crowd there is a bit older. It is indeed a very quiet resort. In fact we were surprised (pleasantly!) at how empty the resort was. For the first three days we were the only people on the beach. The beach was stunning---you can't beat the scenery.
reviews.title: Relaxing getaway in a beautiful spot!

reviews.text: The staff was very attentive and helpful. As far as accomodations, we stayed in an ocean view suite with a jacuzzi. The view was absolutely beautiful, and the room was very comfortable.
reviews.title: Great Place

reviews.text: I highly recommend the sea kayaking---the view of the coast is spectacular.
reviews.title: Paradise found.....
The hotel is writing its own reviews
reviews.text: We both got massages from Lorena (the best we've ever had!) I also got a facial that was excellent.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We drove to El Careyes from San Miguel de Allende, Gto. with an overnight and wonderful Asian-inspired dinner at CocoCabanas on Isla de Navidad (X the inlet from Barra de Navidad).
reviews.title: good and not so good
Cayeres is very special
reviews.text: We stayed there last Christmas.

We had purchased a 5 night package on the Luxury Link site which was a real bargain. It included a dinner with wine and a private table overlooking the beach; all breakfasts; 2 massages; taxes and fees.
reviews.title: Mexican Beach Getaway

likes.liked: — The remote location and quite atmosphere
likes.disliked: — Service could have been a bit better.

reviews.title: Amazing!
reviews.text: The Ocean View Jr Suite # 131 was quite nice and well located.

The included food and a shrimp Ceviche by the pool were as expected (very good), but the drinks on another night (I had the worst Margarita ever and SO's Bloody Mary was close) were the worst we have ever had (and $75. pesos each which is the most we have ever paid in MX).
reviews.title: It wasn't what we expected.

reviews.text: We stayed at El Careyes for 5 nights in mid-February. Even with the excellent reviews on here, our expectations were surpassed! The hotel grounds are truly beautiful, the service was exemplary, and the place is very peaceful. The hotel was full when we arrived because they had a wedding. Many of the guests checked out on our second day there, and as the hotel was no longer full, we were offered to switch rooms to a beautiful suite with a big terrace overlooking the pool and ocean. There were many other nice touches regarding the service - remembering our names, quick responses to requests, nice surprises with the turndown service. The food at the hotel was quite good, and the Playa Rosa restaurant (5 minute walk) serves excellent seafood and fresh fish in a beautiful atmosphere. There is also a beachside "fish hut" a 15 minute walk from the hotel that serves $1- beers and inexpensive fish that were brought in by fisherman that same day. We flew into Manzanillo and rented a car - the drive to the resort was 1h 30m, and not bad at all. The bathrooms are a bit small, but they are also very clean and functional. This place doesn't have a lot of bling luxury (huge marble washrooms, designer furniture) - but at the same time, it feels very comfortable and special. There was an international celebrity staying at the resort with her child at the same time as us, and they both seemed to be having a good time as well.
reviews.title: Great vacation

reviews.text: The hotel is great for a romantic vacation, just getting away from it all, or exploring nature. It wouldn't be great if you're looking for partying or a "stuffy luxury hotel," as El Careyes has a quiet, casual, friendly vibe. Some other advice - bring Pesos with you. The hotel and Playa Rosa take credit cards, but if you want to eat at the fish hut, buy alcohol in town, or go to any other local restaurants you will need local currency. There also aren't any bank machines anywhere, including the Manzanillo airport - although there is a money exchange at the airport.
reviews.title: Quiet, beautiful, amazing getaway spot!!!!!!!!!

reviews.text: My wife and I went to El Careyes for our honeymoon in December 2005. We flew to Puerto Vallarta and opted for the hotel-sponsored car service to save us from the hassles of renting a car and driving. From the minute we stepped out of the car at El Careyes to the moment we left everything was perfect. Upon getting to the resort we were greeted with cold towels to cool our faces and nice cool drinks during our check in. We were given a good tour of the resort, which was almost completely empty at the time. Most of the week we were there we felt like one of few guests there. We had one of the nice junior ocean front suites with our own plunge pool on the deck with spectacular views of the ocean. We quickly realized that there is nothing like going to sleep with the sounds of the ocean waves every night!
reviews.title: Beautiful isolated resort

reviews.text: Our first night there, we were treated to a surprise when we returned to our room after dinner. The resort, knowing that it was our honeymoon, placed a very good bottle of champagne on ice and chocolate dipped strawberries in our room. We were shocked at the gift!
reviews.title: Great common area - room lacking

reviews.text: We spent most of our time lazing around on the beach or the pool side or in our own plunge pool (we kept it cool during the day and about as hot as a hot tub at night). We ate most of our meals at the resort hotel, which was good food at reasonable prices (not as expensive as I expected). We ate two dinners at the Playa Rosa beach, and the food there was even better (and they have excellent daquaris).
reviews.title: Elegant, Relaxing, Peaceful
All very good
reviews.text: After visiting Mexico for over twenty-years, I spent part of our honeymoon at El Careyes. Everything was great: authentic Mexican with a laid-back, but high-end feel, spacious, well-appointed rooms, excellent food, excellent views, the staff was as good as we have experienced, and the overall vibe was very positive. We highy recommend this hotel. A couple of noteworthy issues: there is no life outside this hotel. Its isolated so be prepared for quiet, low-key evenings. The beach is typical of the Pacific- beautiful but not overly inviting for swimming.

reviews.title: Beautiful and Relaxing
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed at El Careyes in late Sept for the first half of our honeymoon. We were looking for a nice, quiet place to relax and unwind after all the wedding stress and Careyes exceeded all of our expectations. The resort is beautiful, with lush scenery, fantastic views, and breathtaking sunsets. The service was fantastic, the staff was very attentive and a lot of fun to talk to, even giving my wife spanish lessons when she tried to remember her high school level spanish. We flew into Puerto Vallarta and drove to El Careyes, which was an easy hour and a half to two hour drive. When we arrived at El Carayes they met us at the front desk with cold drinks and cold compress towels. Then they led us up to our Junior Ocean Front suite. It was a fantastic room, very spacious, with a nice king bed and a very cool porch that had a private plunge pool and a fantastic view out onto the bay. The bathroom was nice and big with a great two person shower, which was nice. The food was fantastic, with a lot of fresh seafood and good mexican cuisine. We were a little concerned over the fact that September is in the middle of the off/rainy season, but we found that for the most part it rained in the evenings/night and although it was hot, it was nice and sunny in the afternoon. The other nice part of being there in September was that there were maybe six other couples at the resort, so it really felt like you had the place to yourself. The only downside to the entire experience was that the beach was a little rocky, but the huge pool was right off the beach and great to relax by. Overall we would absolutely recommend El Careyes to anyone looking for a relaxing holiday in a beautiful atmosphere.

reviews.title: Best Place in Mexico.
reviews.text: This is the best to relax. We have been twice in less than a year and will try to go at least once a year. The second time, we stayed at a beachfront suite with a private pool. Woke up every day right in front of the ocean. You have to go on a fishing trip and see all the beautiful houses in Careyes. This place is one of the best kept secrets in Mexico. The restaurant is OK, but Playa la Rosa restaurant in the beach next to the hotel is one of the best restaurants in Mexico. The weather in Careyes is great year round, even during July and August. Like this place much better than the Four Seasons at Punta Mita.

reviews.title: Best Hotel I've ever stayed in!
reviews.text: I'm ready to go back! The Hotel staff, food, rooms, spa, everything...the best I have ever had! El Careyes far exceeds the Ritz's I have stayed in...I usally stay on club level or penthouse level.....but El Careyes Beach Resort just makes the other places seem more like 3 stars!

We had breakfast every morning in our room within 10 minutes. The pool and grounds were spotless. Food was excellent! Staff so friendly & helpful. (Even having the Owner of a pottery Company call me directly after I showed a strong interest in his works!) Very beautiful, spacious suite.
reviews.title: A romantic escape on the Costa Allegre

description: El Careyes Beach Resort will remain open until July 31st, 2007
